metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33477 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: rxvt-unicode 9.22, rxvt 2.7.10, mrxvt 0.5.4, and Eterm 0.9.7 allow (potentially remote) code execution because of improper handling of certain escape sequences (ESC G Q). A response is terminated by a newline.

criterions.comment: eterm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mrxvt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
rxvt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
rxvt-unicode: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
